Buy for $16 (Reg. $20)

items.title: Upgrade or double up on Samsung’s Bespoke AI all-in-one ventless washer/dryer at $1,999 in early Black Friday savings
items.summary:
As part of its early Black Friday appliance savings, Samsung is offering its Bespoke AI All-in-one Ventless Washer and Dryer Combo at $1,999 shipped, which beats out Best Buy’s pricing by $1. While it fetches $3,299 in full directly from Samsung, we’ve been regularly seeing it down around $2,199 on average over 2025, with discounts having taken it as low as $1,899 from Samsung and $1,700 at other retailers, with that latter low last appearing last year during Christmas sales. There’s also the open-box option from Samsung that can lower costs to $1,599, which you can access on the unit’s main sale page amongst the right-side options. All-in-all, you’re looking at $1,300 savings while this deal lasts, with its newer vented counterpart down at the exact same price.

more…

items.title: Pop a spare AirTag in elago’s Siri Remote case while it’s down to $12.50 Prime shipped
items.summary:
elago Siri Remote AirTag Case

Buy for $12.50 (Reg. $16)

Clip the on-page 15% off coupon.

What we love

While not as small as the old black Siri Remote, the current-generation model is still compact enough to easily  misplace or lose. This case adds a layer of protection while also wielding a dedicated AirTag slot so you can quickly find it from here on out.

items.title: Most affordable Apple Watch Series 10 hits one of its best prices ever at nearly $120 off via Amazon
items.summary:
At this point we expected to see more opportunities to land some all-time low pricing on Apple Watch Series 10. And while there have been some big-time price drops since Series 11 made landfall, the most notable drops have been largely landing on the pricey titanium and cell models. However, over at Amazon right now, you’ll find the Jet Black Series 10 sitting down at one of the best prices we have ever tracked at nearly $120 off the list price.

items.title: Jackery’s early Black Friday power station sale offers up to 65% discounts with bonus 5% + 7% savings starting from $79
items.summary:
Jackery has launched its early Black Friday Sale that is taking up to 65% off its lineup of power stations, complete with bonus 5% (on orders over $1,500) and 7% savings (on orders over $2,500). Among the offers this time around, you can find Jackery’s newest HomePower 3600 Plus Portable Power Station at $1,614.05 shipped, after using the code OFFER5 at checkout, which beats out Amazon’s pricing by $85. This all-new model just hit the market in September with a $2,799 MSRP, which we’ve only seen fall lower to $1,599 and $1,499 in the lead-up and through Prime Day last month. You’re still looking at $1,185 combined savings to the third-lowest price we have tracked, which beats out the more regular $1,699 to $1,799 price we tend to see on it. Head below to check out the full lineup of early Black Friday deals.

items.title: Rare deal drops Razer’s smart laptop Cooling Pad with chroma RGB down to $130 all-time low
items.summary:
We are now tracking a deal at Amazon that drops Razer’s Laptop Cooling Pad down to $129.99 shipped. This particular model that supports 14- to 18-inch laptops hit the scene last year carrying a $180 price tag. It has held firm at full price since its debut until now, and today’s offer at Amazon lands as its first deal that shaves $20 off its usual going rate. This is the lowest price we have tracked for this unit, making this a great time cash in and snag one for your laptop. Head below for more details.

items.title: Expand your M4 Mac mini’s storage and I/O with ORICO’s MiniLink hub, now just $36
items.summary:
ORICO MiniLink M4 Mac mini SATA SSD Hub

Buy for $36 (Reg. $60)

Clip the on-page 40% off coupon.

What we love

First things first, this is hub accepts SATA SSDs, not NVMe. So we want to get that out of the way. This typically means that data transfer speeds won’t be as fast and that you’ll need to specifically buy a SATA SSD. That said, it’s a very affordable and sleek way to expand an M4 Mac mini without breaking the bank.

items.title: Inside Gaza, BBC sees total devastation after two years of war
items.summary: With endless rubble and destroyed streets as far as the eye can see, any plans for Gaza's future are a far cry from where it is today, writes Lucy Williamson.

items.title: Tinder to use AI to get to know users, tap into their Camera Roll photos

items.title: Replika founder raises $20M pre-seed for Wabi, the ‘YouTube of apps’
items.summary: Wabi, a startup from the founder of Replika, has just raised a $20 million pre-seed round. Wabi is like "YouTube for apps" — a social platform where anyone can use prompts to instantly create mini apps and share them with friends.

items.title: Microsoft built a fake marketplace to test AI agents — they failed in surprising ways
items.summary: The research raises new questions about how well AI agents will perform when working unsupervised — and how quickly AI companies can make good on promises of an agentic future.
